New Records: Georgia made their major tournament debut and secured a place in the knockout stages
Key Match Events: Georgia scored in the second minute through Khvicha Kvaratskhelia
Georges Mikautadze converted a second-half penalty
Cristiano Ronaldo was substituted on 66 minutes with only a booking to show for his efforts
Pre-Game Insights: Georgia manager Willy Sagnol told The Athletic they were going “to play with ambition”
Portugal coach Roberto Martinez rotated a team who had already qualified top of Group F
Post-Match Reflections: Cristiano Ronaldo was frustrated and took his frustration out on a water bottle, kicking it at a plastic crate
Portugal coach Roberto Martinez said he now has a much better understanding of which fringe players can step up and contribute in the latter stages of the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: Giorgi Mamardashvili, Georgia's goalkeeper, made several spectacular saves
Georgia's victory means they finish third behind Turkey and they will face Spain in the knockout stages
Others: Football is growing in popularity in Georgia, where emphasis is placed on developing and nurturing young talent
Cristiano Ronaldo's pursuit of becoming the oldest player ever to score at a Euros — he is 39 — goes on
